chapter one I have endeavored to explain
the reason why I have not properly
understood the doctrine of Christ and my
two works a criticism on dogmatic
theology and a new translation
comparison of the four Gospels with a
commentary in these works I examine all
that conceals the truth from the eyes of
men and also retranslate and compare the
four Gospels verse by verse I have been
engaged for some six years upon this
work every year every month I find new
solutions and suggestions and I am
enabled to correct the defects that
creep in through haste or impulse my
life will perhaps and before the work is
complete but I am sure that as much
needed labor I've imposed of myself and
therefore I shall do what I can while my
life lasts this is my outward work on
the theology of the gospel but the inner
working of my soul which I wish to speak
of here was not the result of
methodology and investigation of
doctrinal theology or of the actual text
the gospel it was a sudden removal of
all that hid the true meaning of the
Christian doctrine a momentary flash of
light which made everything clear to me
it was something like that which might
happen to a man who after vainly
attempting by a false planned to build
up a statue out of a confused heap of
small pieces of marble suddenly guesses
that the figure that they are intended
to form by the shape of the largest
piece and then I'm beginning to set up
the statue finds his guest confirmed by
the harmonious joining in on the various
pieces I wish to tell in this work how I
found the key to the doctrine of Christ
by the help of which the truth was
disclosed to me so clearly and
convincingly I made the discovery in the
following manner almost from the first
year of my childhood when I began to
read the gospel for myself the doctrine
that teachers love humility meekness
self-denial and returning good for evil
was the doctrine that touched me most I
always consider it as a basic teaching
of Christianity and loved it as such but
it was only after a long
period of unbelief that it's full
meaning flashed upon me that I
understood life as our unlettered
working classes understood it and
accepted the same creed that they
profess the Creed of the Greek Orthodox
Church but I soon observed that I should
not find in the teaching of the church
the confirmation of my idea that love
humility meekness and self-denial were
the essential principles of Christianity
I saw that this which I regarded as a

is strange my heart has even repulsive

while however submitting to the teaching

more by its indifference to what seemed

Christ and by its evident partiality for
what I am NOT consider an essential part
of that doctrine I felt that there was
something wrong but I could not make out

the main point in the doctrine of Christ
though it failed to given its proper
position and influence I only passed
from Neal ISM to the church because I

faith without a knowledge of what is

than my animal instincts I hope to find
this something in Christianity but
Christianity as it appeared to me then
was only a certain disposition of mine a

I'd longed for but rather alienated me

for the precepts that were given to me

Christ were wanting
moreover the precepts of the church
weakened and sometimes even destroyed
that Christian state of mind that alone

what perplexed me most of all was that

nations or other religions and the

execution and war were justified by the

incompatible with such teachings could

and inconsistent that I could not
believe besides and it always perplexed

dim and mystical expression is it
possible that this was what Christ

the Sermon on the Mount was the portion

nowhere else does Christ speak with such

dissatisfaction the words of God were
not as yet clear to me they seemed to
enjoin an impossible self-denial that
annulled life itself and therefore it
seemed to me that such self-denial could
not be the requirement on which man's

not the expressed condition of salvation
there was nothing
and clear I not only read the Sermon on

after which man must strive that man

why should Christ have given to us such

faith for that faith without which

such statements commended themselves

after having taken away your coat will

Christ does not say let a man strike

whatever men may do to you

it appeared confused to me in the

what it seemed contradictory now became

United in one whole one part fitting

resistance Christ says to his disciples

he reproved Peter who grieved over him
